avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is low. Wet snow is the main problem. Due to solar radiation, small wet loose-snow avalanches can release on very steep slopes naturally. On very steep smooth slopes, esp. on shady slopes, small wet glide-snow avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: On sunny slopes small wet loose-snow avalanches can release

snowpackStructure.comment: During nights of clear skies a melt-freeze crust forms, quickly melts in the daytime. Where the snowfall from Wednesday fell on a cohesive snowpack surface, it is now utterly wet- On southerly slopes and shady slopes, the ground is bare up to 1600 m.

tendency.comment: Avalanche danger levels are not expected to change significantly.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger above 1600 m is moderate, below that altitude danger is low. Main problem: wet snow. On very steep grass-covered slopes and rocks, wet glide-snow avalanches can release naturally. Large releases are sometimes possible.Due to solar radiation, small wet loose-snow avalanches can release in extremely steep terrain.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Avoid snowdrifts and zones below glide cracks.

snowpackStructure.comment: During nights of clear skies a melt-freeze crust forms, quickly melts in the daytime. Where the snowfall from Wednesday fell on a cohesive snowpack surface, it is now utterly wet- On southerly slopes and shady slopes, the ground is bare up to 1600 m.

tendency.comment: Avalanche danger levels are not expected to change significantly.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is low in the moring, and rises to moderate above 1600 m during the course of the day. Main problem: wet snow. On very steep grass-covered slopes and rocks, wet glide-snow avalanches can release naturally. Large releases are sometimes possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Increasingly frequent naturally triggered wet-snow avalanches during the daytime

snowpackStructure.comment: During nights of clear skies a melt-freeze crust forms, quickly melts in the daytime. Where the snowfall from Wednesday fell on a cohesive snowpack surface, it is now utterly wet- On southerly slopes and shady slopes, the ground is bare up to 1600 m.

tendency.comment: Avalanche danger levels are not expected to change significantly.
